Value Statement: As an SE supporting GenAnn, I want to enable the thick mode oracle library in their lambda layers, so they can read and write to the VBMS database using a lambda.

AC: GenAnn lambdas have read/write permissions to VBMS Oracle DB.

Value Statement: As a member of the Gen-Ann team, we want to calculate and persist BERT similarity scores between each AnnotatedText and its corresponding GeneratedSummary because this shared semantic signal will let all current and future teams (including VA stakeholders) reliably reuse the enrichment without re-computing it, enabling consistent downstream analytics, quality monitoring, and feature development.

Acceptance Criteria: Daily scheduled batch job processes only previously unscored (or changed) AnnotatedText–GeneratedSummary pairs, computes BERT similarity, persists score + model version, and updates last-run state without duplicating or recomputing existing scores.

items.to_string:
Title - Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction
Value Statement
- As a platform member supporting the Gen-Ann team, I want to develop a SageMaker pipeline that reads user metrics from the VBMS database. This foundational capability will ensure that the data needed for future semantic enrichment (such as similarity scoring and analytics) is reliably ingested and made available, supporting consistent downstream analytics and quality monitoring.Acceptance Criteria * A SageMaker pipeline is created (in dev) with a single stage: reading user metrics from the VBMS database.
 * Database connection logic for source VBMS is implemented and tested.
 * No similarity scoring or write-back logic is included in this step.
 * The pipeline template/script allows for future extensibility to add additional processing stages (e.g., similarity scoring).

items.from_string: Implement Scheduled VBMS Ingestion & Similarity Scoring Pipeline with DB Write-Back for Gen Ann
items.to_string: Implement SageMaker Pipeline for VBMS User Metrics Extraction

Value Statement: As a MLOps engineer and the SE for the SCC team, I want to build a modular SageMaker Pipeline composed of reusable templates for each ingestion step (scraping M21, parsing/reformatting, updating the Knowledge Base) so that new sources can be onboarded rapidly, runs are repeatable/observable, and failures are recoverable with minimal operator effort.

SageMaker Pipeline definition with three steps: - Scrape M21 site (fetch pages, store raw HTML/text to S3). - Parse & Reformat (convert to clean text/JSON with metadata: title, URL, timestamp, section headings, checksum; write to curated S3 prefix). - Update Knowledge Base (load curated docs into KB index; upsert by document ID/checksum; maintain ingestion log).

Acceptance Criteria:

AC1 – Pipeline creation

AC2 – Step templates

AC3 – Scrape step output

AC4 – Parse & Reformat output

AC5 – Knowledge Base update
prepare and present demo to BID regarding playwright MCP and access for all BID members

**Value Statement:** As a frontend developer, I want the primary XRD listing, resource viewing, and pause/unpause functionality migrated to Go so that the existing Vue.js frontend continues to work without modification.

**Dependencies:** - Story 1: Core API Foundation Migration must be completed

**Acceptance Criteria:** - Given a request to /xrds when authenticated then it returns all XRDs in the same JSON format as Python API - Given a request to /xrds/\{name} when authenticated then it returns the specific XRD details matching Python API response - Given a request to /xrds/\{name}/claims when authenticated then it returns all claims for that XRD - Given a request to /list-all-cached-resources when admin authenticated then it returns all cached resources - Given a request to /list-paused-resources when authenticated then it returns all paused resources in the same format - Given a POST to /pause-resource with valid payload when admin authenticated then it successfully pauses or resumes the resource - Given any XRD route request when processed then tenant access controls are properly enforced - Given the existing Vue.js frontend when pointed to the Go API then all primary views load and function correctly

**Definition of Done:** - All acceptance criteria met - Tests added/updated (unit + integration) - Documentation updated (README / API docs) - XRD service layer implemented with caching - Resource pause/unpause functionality fully migrated - Admin access controls implemented and tested - Vue.js frontend compatibility validated - Performance benchmarks show improvement over Python API

Value Statement:
 As a tenant who references and executes Jupyter notebooks, I need a comprehensive tutorial notebook that demonstrates both the setup and usage of Bedrock Data Automation projects, so that I can confidently create, configure, and operate Bedrock Data Automation workflows using my own or sample data.


Acceptance Criteria:
 * When a tenant opens the tutorial notebook, the tenant has the ability to create and work with a Bedrock Data Automation project end-to-end using sample or tenant-specific data.
 * The notebook provides clear, step-by-step instructions, annotated code examples, and explanations covering both setup and operational workflows.
 * Functionality of the notebook is validated through manual testing, and documentation is published or linked within the notebook for tenant reference.

Value Statement: As an MLOps engineer, I want to extract reusable Bedrock-related code from our Bedrock tutorial notebooks and integrate it into the GenAI module (Bedrock Client) of the RAF – Reusable Agentic Framework, so that all projects using Bedrock have a unified, maintainable, and production-grade implementation for model invocation and configuration management.

Description: The Bedrock tutorial notebooks currently contain several reusable code components. This task involves consolidating that reusable logic and integrating it into the GenAI module of the RAF (Reusable Agentic Framework) — specifically, the Bedrock client layer. The goal is to provide a centralized, well-structured client for Bedrock model interactions (e.g., text generation, embedding, and prompt management) that can be easily imported and extended by other modules or services.

Acceptance Criteria: Code Identification - Review all Bedrock tutorial notebooks to identify reusable components - Determine which components are general-purpose enough to be integrated into RAF. Integration into RAF - Create or update the GenAI module’s Bedrock client within the RAF repository. - Integrate identified reusable code, ensuring modular design and adherence to RAF’s existing structure and naming conventions. - Include docstrings, type hints, and follow PEP8 style guidelines. Testing - Add or update unit tests within the RAF test suite for the Bedrock client. - Validate that existing RAF modules using the Bedrock client work without regression. Documentation - Update RAF documentation to describe: -- Bedrock client architecture within GenAI module -- Example usage and expected input/output formats Validation - Confirm that existing Bedrock tutorial notebooks can use the new RAF client without functional loss by importing from RAF instead of redefining code locally.

items.from_string: Incorprorate any functional code in bedrock tutorials into RAF
items.to_string: Incorporate any functional code in bedrock tutorials into RAF

This task involves consolidating that reusable logic and integrating it into the GenAI module of the RAF (Reusable Agentic Framework) — specifically, the Bedrock client layer. {*}Title{*}: Incorporate knowledge base code in bedrock tutorials in RAF
*Value Statement:*
 As an MLOps engineer who integrates Bedrock functionality into shared frameworks, I need to incorporate the Bedrock knowledge-base capabilities from our tutorial notebooks into the RAF GenAI module so that all tenants can use a unified interface for Bedrock knowledge-base operations.
*Acceptance Criteria:* * Integrate reusable Bedrock knowledge-base logic into the RAF GenAI module, following existing structure, naming conventions, and coding standards.
 * Update knowledge base tutorial in tenant resources with updated GenAI module
 * Add or update tests to validate tenant scoping, correctness of functionality, and compatibility with existing RAF modules and Bedrock tutorials.
 * Update RAF documentation and examples to describe usage, configuration, and migration from the tutorial notebooks to the RAF implementation.

Value Statement: As a BIP‑AI MLOps Engineer, I need a full‑featured RAF-Strands agent reference implementation that extends the prior basic prototype and shows how the agent plugs into the existing mlkit architecture (reusable utilities, MCPs, etc.), so other engineers can reuse it as a pattern for building similar agents without re-discovering integration details.

AC: Example notebook created on how to create a strands agent, deploy it lambda, and query it.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28501

Value Statement: As an MLE creating and maintaining MLKit, I want to attach the dev and stable LCCs to all domains and remove unused LCCs so that tenants only have one LCC to choose from.

AC: LCCs tested and pushed to all domains, all other LCCs removed from tenant domains.

Value Statement: As a tenant user who builds dashboards and visualizes metrics in Grafana, I need the ability to reference a clear SOP on aggregating metrics and designing effective panels so that I can produce accurate, performant, and consistent dashboards aligned with BIP-AI monitoring standards.

Acceptance Criteria: - When a tenant accesses the SOP in Confluence, the document clearly explains how to aggregate metrics (e.g., sum, avg, max) and apply best practices for panel creation and performance optimization. - When the SOP draft is complete, it is reviewed and approved by the BIP-AI team to ensure alignment with monitoring and dashboarding standards. - When the SOP is published, Confluence documentation is updated and version-controlled, and references are added to the tenant onboarding or monitoring documentation set.

Value Statement: As a BIP-AI team member who manages and maintains Grafana monitoring assets, I need the ability to define and deploy Grafana dashboards and alerts using IaC) so that we can achieve consistent, automated, and version-controlled deployments across environments.

Acceptance Criteria: -When the exploration is complete, a Confluence document is created detailing the IaC options, integration feasibility, and an action plan for implementing automated Grafana asset deployment. -When evaluating tools, the team collaborates with the BIP-AI infrastructure team to identify appropriate IaC solutions -When the POC or findings are reviewed, the BIP-AI team approves next steps, and the documentation is linked in the monitoring and automation reference materials.

Value Statement: As a BIP MLOps engineer, Tenants require the ability to use the cookie cutter template which incorporates github actions for linting, testing on push Description: The github actions in the cookie cutter do not work currently, they need to be fixed and improved then applied to tenant repos.

Acceptance Criteria: - PR for cookie cutter template mlops-template repo.

Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to deploy the Kubernetes ServiceAccount for Harness IRSA to the stage namespace, so that Harness jobs in the stage environment can use IRSA securely and consistently.

Acceptance Criteria: - A Kubernetes ServiceAccount manifest is created and named using the convention `stage-bip-ai-*`. - The ServiceAccount is deployed to the stage namespace and references the Harness IRSA role using the `eks.amazonaws.com/role-arn` annotation. - The deployment is validated by confirming that Harness jobs in the stage namespace can assume the IRSA role and perform required actions. - Documentation is updated to include steps for deploying and validating the ServiceAccount in the stage environment. **Additional Context:** - This is a follow-up to adapting the Crossplane composition for Harness IRSA roles. - Reference implementation: [foundation-cicd-support-composition.yaml]

Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want a Docker image preconfigured with Python, VA certificates, and all necessary dependencies for running Locust load tests, so that I can reliably execute load tests using the Locust CLI and retrieve the image from Nexus for use in automated harness pipelines.

AC: - A Dockerfile is created that installs: - Python (specific version as required) - Locust CLI and its dependencies - VA certificates required for the test environment - The Docker image builds successfully and passes a health check (e.g., Locust CLI launches, certificates are accessible). - The image is tagged appropriately (e.g., `locust-cli:latest`) and pushed to the designated Nexus repository.

items.from_string: Build docker image for Golden Load Test Pipeline
items.to_string: Build docker image for Load Test Pipeline

Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want to enable the SBX delegates within the Harness management instance so that sandbox environments are able to execute workflows and pipelines securely and reliably using delegated resources.

AC: - SBX delegates are registered and enabled within the Harness management instance. - Delegates are configured with proper permissions and connectivity to required environments. - Documentation is updated to include steps for enabling, registering, and troubleshooting SBX delegates. - Validation is performed by running sample workflows/pipelines using the SBX delegates in the sandbox environment. - Any issues, errors, or limitations encountered during enablement are documented and communicated to stakeholders.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28490

items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to create a golden set, highly templatized Harness pipeline for deploying SageMaker processing jobs, so that teams can quickly reuse and adapt the pipeline for different processing jobs using input sets.

AC: Harness pipeline is created to automate deployment of SageMaker processing jobs. The pipeline supports a variety of input sets . The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse. The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use. The template supports parameterization for common deployment variables. Pipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.

items.from_string: Golden set pipeline for SageMaker processing jobs

Value Statement: As a BIP AI engineer, I want to create a highly templatized Harness pipeline for deploying SageMaker processing jobs, so that teams can quickly reuse and adapt the pipeline for different processing jobs using input sets.

AC: Harness pipeline is created to automate deployment of SageMaker processing jobs. The pipeline supports a variety of input sets . The pipeline is modular and templatized, allowing easy customization and reuse. The pipeline is saved as a Harness template and documented for other users to pull and use. The template supports parameterization for common deployment variables. Pipeline is tested and validated for at least one real deployment scenario.

Value Statement: As a DevSecOps engineer, I want to develop an implementation plan for adding image signing procedures to our container image build pipelines in harness, based on the Platform Zero Trust policy, so that our images are securely signed and compliant with security requirements. I want to develop an implementation plan for adding image signing procedures to our container image build pipelines, based on the Platform Zero Trust policy, so that our images are securely signed and compliant with security requirements.

AC: - Identify integration points and required changes to current build pipelines for image signing. - Select appropriate image signing tools and methods (e.g., cosign, Notary, etc.) in line with Zero Trust recommendations. - Draft a step-by-step implementation plan including prerequisites, configuration, and automation steps. - Document plan in the repo and share it with relevant stakeholders. - Include security validation steps and ongoing compliance checks. - Identify integration points and required changes to current build pipelines for image signing. - Select appropriate image signing tools and methods (e.g., cosign, Notary, etc.) in line with Zero Trust recommendations. - Draft a step-by-step implementation plan including prerequisites, configuration, and automation steps. - Document plan in the repo and share it with relevant stakeholders. - Include security validation steps and ongoing compliance checks.

Value Statement: As a BIP AI Engineer who builds custom images, I need the ability to automatically attach custom images (most likely using Harness) so that my workflow is less error-prone (like when using AWS CLI).

AC: A user can go into Harness, specify their GitHub repo, branch, Dockerfile path etc (similar to the current image-builder job), and not only be able to push to ECR (which we already have), but also attach the image to Sagemaker Studio domains (most likely thru AWS CLI commands in a Dockerfile), and be able to select it in the Image dropdown when starting up a space Also, mlkit custom image is attached to all domains.

Value Statement: As a bip ai engineer, I want a Docker image preconfigured with Python, Playwright, all required browser drivers, and VA certificates so that I can reliably run automated tests in a consistent environment and retrieve the image from Nexus for use in CI/CD pipelines.

AC: - A Dockerfile is created that installs: - Python (specific version as required) - Playwright and its dependencies - Supported browser drivers (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit) - VA certificates required for the test environment - The Docker image builds successfully and passes a health check (e.g., Python and Playwright are available, browsers launch, certificates are accessible). - The image is tagged appropriately (e.g., `automated-testing-playwright:latest`) and pushed to the designated Nexus repository.

Value Statement: As a DevOps Engineer I want to create a templatized Harness Service for deploying AWS Lambda functions So that I can automate and manage Lambda deployments consistently across environments.

AC: - Harness AWS connector is configured with sufficient Lambda permissions. - Artifact connectors (S3 or ECR) are created for Lambda deployment package or image. - A new Harness Service is defined for AWS Lambda, specifying deployment type and relevant configuration. - Service variables are established for function name, handler, runtime, memory, timeout, role ARN, and artifact details. - Environment and Infrastructure definitions for AWS region are set up. - Pipeline Deploy stage is configured to use the Service and Environment, with runtime inputs for artifact/version.

Value Statement: As an engineer I want to parse the logs coming from ARIA so we can begin managing usage and other metrics for a dashboard.

AC: Grafana dashboard with different logs parsed so metrics can be created later.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28497

Value Statement: As an engineer I need to research and document the way we will use strands in ARIA.

AC: Confluence document with strands orchestration.

Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce monthly status reports to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these reports are submitted by the expected due dates.

Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce biweekly reports to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these reports are submitted by the expected due dates.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28498

Value Statement: As a team lead, I need to produce monthly deliverables to satisfy VA requirements and ensure communication on team updates.

Working with other leads, we will ensure these deliverables are submitted by the expected due dates.

items.from_string: As a BIP AI engineer, I want the Lambda Deployment pipeline currently implemented in Jenkins to be migrated to Harness as a Harness-managed pipeline AC: Harness pipeline is managed as YAML in the bip-ai-harness repo. All Jenkins pipeline stages and parameters are replicated, with any redesign needed to work smoothly with the IaC for lambda creation implemented. Final YAML is documented for usage and triggers. Pipeline passes tests and matches Jenkins logic.
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a MLOps Engineer who deploys lambda functions for tenants, I need the ability to complete testing on the Jenkins lambda deployment pipeline so that lambdas can be deployed via .zip or container based deployments.


A/C: When a user triggers the jenkins lambda deployment pipeline, the user has the ability to deploy via containers instead of just .zip based deployments
fully tested for container based deployments
Existing features updated to work smoothly w/ IaC lambda provisioning
Separate pipelines able to be spawned for each lambda similar to the image builder pipeline

items.from_string:
Value Statement:

As a BIP AI Tenant on the SCC team, I need the ability to receive timely support so that I can resolve issues and continue my work without unnecessary delays.

Acceptance Criteria:

When a user from SCC requests support, the support team responds and assists as needed. Manual validation: Confirm support requests are tracked and resolved. Update deployment dates in Confluence for each support ticket.
items.to_string:
Value Statement: As a BIP-AI MLOps Engineer who is experimenting and evaluating different methods to scrape the VA intranet for M21-1 documentation, I need a verified way to scrape for m21 so that I have the ability to programmatically parse and ingest the m21 document for future Knowledge Base refreshing—starting with scraping.

Acceptance Criteria: The user can scrape the intranet for m21. - Confluence documentation is updated in on different methods -Manual tests were added: manual tests in sagemaker Assumptions: Scraping is feasible with at least one method Notes: Context on existing MCP work can assist with finding a solution and determining feasibility to scrape the VA intranet.
This issue is cloned by BIP-28766
This issue is cloned by BIP-28243
